justification: The article notes that in classical psychophysics "sensory thresholds were measured by asking observers to adjust the intensity of a test stimulus until it matched that of a standard," identifying the method of adjustment as the measurement technique.

topic_or_construct: visual working memory precision for color
visual working memory precision for orientation
visual working memory precision for spatial frequency
justification: Referring to Wilken & Ma (2004), the paper states that a continuous-outcome task "was used to investigate the precision of visual working memory for color, orientation, and spatial frequency," linking the task to those precision constructs.
The authors mention that Blake et al. (1997) "used [continuous-outcome tasks] to study visual working memory for motion," directly pairing the construct with the task as its measure.

The text notes that the task "has also been used to investigate categorical perception of color and categorical recall of color from short-term and long-term memory," indicating the continuous-outcome task as the measurement instrument.

topic_or_construct: decision accuracy and timing for coherent motion
justification: The paper describes applying diffusion models "to decisions about coherent motion in the random dot motion (RDM) task" and later treats the continuous-outcome RDM task as providing the empirical data on decision outcomes and response times.
